Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getKeywords

Description.name: Description
Description.val:
This API lists out all the keywords that is used by the mp3quran.net for a specific language. These are the keywords which are required to be translated in the target language in order to use the mp3quran.net API's in the new language. For instance, in order for you to use the api in arabic, the following words are required to be tranlsated in the arabic language and saved in the mp3quran.net database. The below api is illustrated with an example of how the api would be look when the keywords are translated in arabic language. Following are the list of supported languages.
-----
العربية
English
Français
Русский
Deutsch
Español
Türkçe
中文
ไทย
اردو
বাংলা
Bosanski
ئۇيغۇرچە
فارسى
Тоҷикӣ
മലയാളം
Tagalog
Indonesia
Português
Hausa
Kiswahili

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
HTTP GET
The below is illustrated with English and arabic as the target language of translation.

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val: http://api.mp3quran.net/api/translations

Inputs.description:
"Contains the language against which the API was invoked . 								
Valid values include the 21 languages which the API supports"
Inputs.example:
ar, en, fr, ru, de, es, tr, cn, th, ur, bn, bs, ug, fa, tg, ml, tl, id, pt, ha, sw 								
Ex: http://api.mp3quran.net/api/translations?languages=en

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'language' in the target language.
Outputs.example: For instance, the translation of the word language in arabic is اللغة , and in english is 'language' itself .

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'Quran' in the target language.
Outputs.example: For instance , quran can be called as    "القران الكريم"   in arabic or 'The Noble Quran' in english.

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'reciters' in the target language.
Outputs.example: For instance the word 'reciters' can be translated as "القرا in arabic, and as reciters in ENGLISH.

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'sura' in the target language.
The translation of the word 'suras' in the target language.
The translation of the word 'surah_no' in the target language. Refers to the number of the surah.
Outputs.example: Surah No. (in english) , رقم السورة (in arabic)

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'Surah Name ' in the target language.
Outputs.example: Surah Name (in english) , اسم السورة (in arabic)

Outputs.description: The translation of the word 'Complete Qur'an ' in the target language.
The translation of the word 'Listen ' in the target language.
The translation of the word 'Download  ' in the target language.

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getSupportedLanguages

Description.name: Description
Description.val:
"This API lists the languages supported by the mp3quran system and provides the url link to the surahs in the supported languages.
The API currently supports 21 languages."

Description.name: API Method
Description.val: HTTP GET

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val: http://mp3quran.net/api/get_json.php

Outputs.description: The root node of the API listing all the languages below it.
Internal id of the language  in the mp3Quran database.
Name of the language
The json url of the api in the target language
The json url of the surah api in the target language . This url will list out the name of the surahs in the target language.

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: get each ayah (verse) in one file

Description.name: Description
Description.val: This API gets the list of reciters whose recitatation is available for verse by verse recitation. there are 3 types of bit rates (32,64 and 128), currently we have 40 reciters.

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
Main API:
http://api.mp3quran.net/verse/verse.php

Example of arabic version:
http://api.mp3quran.net/verse/verse_ar.json

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val:
HTTP GET
The below is illustrated with arabic as the target language of translation.

Outputs.description: Represents the list of reciters available in the mp3 quran system.
Internal id of the reciter in the mp3Quran database.
Name of the reciter in the target langauge,
Url of the reciter
Yes/No. Representing if the recitation is available in full.
Total number of surahs that has been recited .
The bit rate of the audio
Represents the riwaya , in which the recitation is available
Murattal/Mujawad mushaf

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getReciters

Description.name: Description
Description.val: "This API gets the list of reciters available in the mp3quran system. The details of the reciters are available in the target language ."

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
HTTP GET
 The below is illustrated with English as the target language of translation.

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val:
http://mp3quran.net/api/_english.php
 You can use the getSupportedLanguages API to get the list of lanugages supported.

Inputs.description: "Contains the language against which the API was invoked .

Inputs.root: Valid values include the 21 languages which the API supports"

Inputs.description: surah = valid value includes from 1 to 114 [Represents the chapter number of the Quran]

Outputs.description: Represents the list of reciters available in the mp3 quran system.
Internal id of the reciter in the mp3Quran database.
Name of the reciter in the target langauge,
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in arabic language.
Represents the riwayah of the current recitation.
Represents the total number of surahs avaiable for recitation by the current reciter.
First letter of the name of the reciter . Helps in listing the reciter in alphabetical order.
Comma seperated values of surah number that are avaiable for recitation by the current reciter.

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getSurah/getChapter

Description.name: Description
Description.val:
This API gets the translation of the Surah in the requested language.
The API has a default translation , against which the translation of the Surah is rendered .

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
HTTP GET
The below is illustrated with English as the target language of translation.

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val: http://api.mp3quran.net/api/surah

Inputs.description: "Contains the language against which the API was invoked .

Inputs.root: Valid values include the 21 languages which the API supports"

Inputs.description: surah = valid value includes from 1 to 114 [Represents the chapter number of the Quran]

Outputs.description: Represents the ayah (verse) , about which the information is given,
Represents the language against which the translation is provided. This field represents the abbrivated language that was passed in the sample,

Outputs.root: [In the current example, the input parameter that was passed was 'en', hence the output was English.]"

Outputs.description: Represents the surah number of the sample
Represents the verse number  [Similair to ayahNumber mentioned above]
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in arabic language.
URL to the arabic snippet image of the ayah
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in the selected language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in arabic language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in target language.
Outputs.response: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

Outputs.description: Contains the additional explanation/tafseer of the ayah in the target language.
Outputs.response: "1- Al-Fatiha: The Opening (of the Quran). Note: Surah titles are not an integral part of the Quran. A distinguishing word in a particular Surah or a word defining its subject matter often became a common means of identification among the Prophet's companions and later scholars. Although some names, such as al-Fatiha, were used by the Prophet in reference to a particular Surah, they were not specifically designated by him as titles. 2- Allah is a proper name belonging only to the one Almighty God, Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is within them, the Eternal and Absolute, to whom alone all worship is due. 3- Ar-Rahman and ar-Raheem are two names of Allah derived from the word \"rahmah\" (mercy). In Arabic grammar both are intensive forms of \"merciful\" (i.e., extremely merciful). A complimentary and comprehensive meaning is intended by using both together. Rahman is used only to describe Allah, while raheem might be used to describe a person as well. The Prophet was described in the Quran as raheem. Rahman is above the human level (i.e., intensely merciful). Since one usually understands intensity to be something of short duration, Allah describes Himself also as raheem (i.e., continually merciful). Rahman also carries a wider meaning - merciful to all creation. Justice is a part of this mercy. Raheem includes the concept of speciality - especially and specifically merciful to the believers. Forgiveness is a part of this mercy. In addition, Rahman is adjectival, referring to an attribute of Allah and is part of His essence. Raheem is verbal, indicating what He does: i.e., bestowing and implementing mercy."

Outputs.description: Details of the translation that is used to translate the ayah. Typically refers to the name of the translation.
URL to the recitation of the specific ayah
Bitrate of the MP3 recitation of the ayah

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getAyah/getSingleVerse

Description.name: Description
Description.val:
"This API gets the translation of one single verse (ayah) in the requested language.
The API has a default translation , against which the translation of the ayah is rendered . "

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
HTTP GET
The below is illustrated with English as the target language of translation.

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val: http://api.mp3quran.net/api/aya

Inputs.description: "Contains the language against which the API was invoked .

Inputs.root: Valid values include the 21 languages which the API supports"

Inputs.description: surah = valid value includes from 1 to 114 [Represents the chapter number of the Quran]
aya=valid value of the verse of the sampleed surah

Outputs.description: Represents the ayah (verse) , about which the information is given. [In this api, it refers to the aya number that was passed in the sample]
Represents the language against which the translation is provided. This field represents the abbrivated language that was passed in the sample,

Outputs.root: [In the current example, the input parameter that was passed was 'en', hence the output was English.]"

Outputs.description: Represents the surah number of the sample
Represents the verse number  [Similair to ayahNumber mentioned above]
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in arabic language.
URL to the arabic snippet image of the ayah
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in the selected language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in arabic language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in target language.
Outputs.response: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

Outputs.description: Contains the additional explanation/tafseer of the ayah in the target language.
Outputs.response: "1- Al-Fatiha: The Opening (of the Quran). Note: Surah titles are not an integral part of the Quran. A distinguishing word in a particular Surah or a word defining its subject matter often became a common means of identification among the Prophet's companions and later scholars. Although some names, such as al-Fatiha, were used by the Prophet in reference to a particular Surah, they were not specifically designated by him as titles. 2- Allah is a proper name belonging only to the one Almighty God, Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is within them, the Eternal and Absolute, to whom alone all worship is due. 3- Ar-Rahman and ar-Raheem are two names of Allah derived from the word \"rahmah\" (mercy). In Arabic grammar both are intensive forms of \"merciful\" (i.e., extremely merciful). A complimentary and comprehensive meaning is intended by using both together. Rahman is used only to describe Allah, while raheem might be used to describe a person as well. The Prophet was described in the Quran as raheem. Rahman is above the human level (i.e., intensely merciful). Since one usually understands intensity to be something of short duration, Allah describes Himself also as raheem (i.e., continually merciful). Rahman also carries a wider meaning - merciful to all creation. Justice is a part of this mercy. Raheem includes the concept of speciality - especially and specifically merciful to the believers. Forgiveness is a part of this mercy. In addition, Rahman is adjectival, referring to an attribute of Allah and is part of His essence. Raheem is verbal, indicating what He does: i.e., bestowing and implementing mercy."

Outputs.description: Details of the translation that is used to translate the ayah. Typically refers to the name of the translation.
URL to the recitation of the specific ayah
Bitrate of the MP3 recitation of the ayah

Description.name: API Name
Description.val: getAyat/getVersesByRange

Description.name: Description
Description.val:
"This API gets the translation of many verses (ayats) in the requested language by specifiying the range.
The API has a default translation , against which the translation of the ayah is rendered . "

Description.name: API Method
Description.val:
HTTP GET
The below is illustrated with English as the target language of translation.

Description.name: API Endpoint
Description.val: http://api.mp3quran.net/api/ayat

Inputs.description: "Contains the language against which the API was invoked .

Inputs.root: Valid values include the 21 languages which the API supports"

Inputs.description: surah = valid value includes from 1 to 114 [Represents the chapter number of the Quran]
ayaNumber ith respective to the surah chosen
ayaNumber ith respective to the surah chosen

Outputs.description: Represents the ayah (verse) , about which the information is given . [In this API, it refers to the range specified in the sample]
Represents the language against which the translation is provided. This field represents the abbrivated language that was passed in the sample,

Outputs.root: [In the current example, the input parameter that was passed was 'en', hence the output was English.]"

Outputs.description: Represents the surah number of the sample
Represents the verse number  [Similair to ayahNumber mentioned above]
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in arabic language.
URL to the arabic snippet image of the ayah
Represents the name of the chapter (surah) in the selected language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in arabic language.
Represents the verse (ayah)  from the chapter  (surah) in target language.
Outputs.response: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

Outputs.description: Contains the additional explanation/tafseer of the ayah in the target language.
Outputs.response: "1- Al-Fatiha: The Opening (of the Quran). Note: Surah titles are not an integral part of the Quran. A distinguishing word in a particular Surah or a word defining its subject matter often became a common means of identification among the Prophet's companions and later scholars. Although some names, such as al-Fatiha, were used by the Prophet in reference to a particular Surah, they were not specifically designated by him as titles. 2- Allah is a proper name belonging only to the one Almighty God, Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is within them, the Eternal and Absolute, to whom alone all worship is due. 3- Ar-Rahman and ar-Raheem are two names of Allah derived from the word \"rahmah\" (mercy). In Arabic grammar both are intensive forms of \"merciful\" (i.e., extremely merciful). A complimentary and comprehensive meaning is intended by using both together. Rahman is used only to describe Allah, while raheem might be used to describe a person as well. The Prophet was described in the Quran as raheem. Rahman is above the human level (i.e., intensely merciful). Since one usually understands intensity to be something of short duration, Allah describes Himself also as raheem (i.e., continually merciful). Rahman also carries a wider meaning - merciful to all creation. Justice is a part of this mercy. Raheem includes the concept of speciality - especially and specifically merciful to the believers. Forgiveness is a part of this mercy. In addition, Rahman is adjectival, referring to an attribute of Allah and is part of His essence. Raheem is verbal, indicating what He does: i.e., bestowing and implementing mercy."

Outputs.description: Details of the translation that is used to translate the ayah. Typically refers to the name of the translation.
URL to the recitation of the specific ayah
Bitrate of the MP3 recitation of the ayah
